intro: Cupaniopsis rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf cupaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rounded leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces fruit that is a capsule containing several seeds, and it is often found in shrubland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
